Our bodies are like machines that get older and wear out over time. This is called aging. Gerontology is the study of aging and how it affects our bodies. Scientists who study gerontology want to know how to make us healthier and stronger as we age. They look at our biological clock, which is like a timer that counts down the seconds, minutes, and years of our lives. As we get older, our biological clock starts to slow down, and our bodies start to wear out. But scientists are working hard to understand how to keep our bodies healthy and strong for a long time.

As we age, our bodies undergo changes that affect how they work. One reason for aging is the shortening of our telomeres, which are like protective caps on the ends of our chromosomes. Chromosomes are the thread-like structures that carry our DNA, or genetic instructions. When our telomeres get too short, our cells can't divide properly, leading to aging. This is a natural part of life, but it can also be influenced by our lifestyle and environment. By taking care of ourselves, we can slow down the aging process and stay healthy for longer. Everyone ages, but we can age well.
